Wong et al. recently published in the Canadian Journal of Anesthesia the experience of a major hospital in Singapore on the response of the Anesthesiology team to this new coronavirus epidemic.
26 Recommendations included decrease in elective surgeries as a way of increasing total hospital capacity, in addition to preserving the workforce of physicians. Measures to decrease unnecessary personnel circulating in the hospital and appropriate triage of employees and patients with signs and symptoms of COVID-19 were implemented. Measures to enhance communication among physicians and other health professionals were also implemented, in addition to material and a direct channel to care for professionals who reported anxiety or presented signs of COVID-19 epidemic-related burnout. 26, 27
